trans-unit.source: Represents a key identifier.
Typically, the SecurityKeyIdentifier is not used, other than when a custom security token service is created.
When a security token service returns a security token, the issued security token contains references to attached and unattached security tokens.

Attached references refer to security tokens that are contained within the security header of a SOAP message and unattached references are security tokens that are not included within the security header of a SOAP message.
These references typically affirm the authenticity of the issued security token.
These references are represented by classes that derive from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause> class.
The SecurityKeyIdentifier class contains the collection of these references.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> class using the specified key identifier clauses.
An array of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that contains the key identifier clauses.
clauses is .
Adds a key identifier clause to the end of the list.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> to be added to the end of the list.
clause is .
The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier.IsReadOnly*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether a key can be created for at least one of the key identifier clauses.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a key can be created for at least one of the key identifier clauses; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the number of key identifier clauses.
The number of key identifier clauses.
Creates a key for one of the key identifier clauses.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey> that is returned is for the first key identifier clause in the collection that can create a key.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that represents the created key.
A key could not be created for any of the key identifier clauses.
To be added.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection of key identifier clauses.
A <xref:System.Collections.Generic.List%601.Enumerator> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> for the collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the key identifier clause at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the key identifier clause in the collection of key identifier clauses.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> at the specified index.
index is less than 0.
-or- index is equal to or greater than .
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
For example, a key identifier clause cannot be added to this object.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection of key identifier clauses.
A <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator%601> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Returns the current object.
The ToString method returns the details of all of the key identifier clauses in the key identifier.
The current object.
To be added.
To be added.
